text: You can use the vscodedview or so which is the native :vscode: support for viewing tabular data. You can also use the explorer to view arrays, tabular data and other structures in a separate tab. Plots are handled through a separate panel.

elements.text: You can use the vscodedview or so which is the native
support for viewing tabular data. You can also use the explorer to view arrays, tabular data and other structures in a separate tab. Plots are handled through a separate panel.

text: TableView is lazy, though. So I would imagine the VS code support would not be competitive for even moderately sized datasets

text: I can’t recall if the VS code one is lazy or not but I suspect so. I have use it with pretty big objects without issues

text: hm would be worth testing. Cause the laziness of tableview is it's killer feature

text: I recall a discussion about implementing lazy views in Vscode, so at that point it definitely wasn't, but this might have changed
